newsitem.title: ITALY: ENI-Agip merger seen positive - analysts.
newsitem.headline: ENI-Agip merger seen positive - analysts.

text.p: Industry analysts said the move by Italy's state-controlled energy group ENI to absorb its oil exploration and production unit Agip was positive and would help the group focus on its core business.
ENI also said it intends to pay a 1996 dividend of 240 lire per share, compared with 215 lire in 1995, and analysts said this was in line with market forecasts.
Analysts added that the move would help ENI focus on its core oil and gas exploration and production activities, and streamline the organisation of the group.

"The positive hope was that ENI had indicated it was simplifying its organisation, and it is now doing this," said analyst Claudia Vignati at brokers Credito Italiano, adding that the cost reductions from the merger will not be dramatic.
ENI said the merger, which must be approved by a shareholders' meeting planned for June 19 or 20, was intended to increase efficiency in the group's operations. ENI is the sole shareholder in Agip.
